text: Alberto Horacio Suppici (20 November 1898 – 21 June 1981) was a Uruguayan footballer and manager. He was the first manager to win the FIFA World Cup. Suppici's nickname was el Profesor (the Professor).Prof. Alberto Suppici ==Honours== ===Domestic=== ; Peñarol *Uruguayan Primera División: 1945 ===International=== Uruguay * Copa Newton: 1929 * Copa Lipton: 1929 * FIFA World Cup: 1930 * Copa América runner-up: 1941; third place: 1929, 1937 * Copa Héctor Rivadavia Gómez: 1936, 1940 * Taça Rio Branco: 1940 ==References== Category:1898 births Category:1981 deaths Category:Uruguayan footballers Category:Uruguayan football managers Category:Association football defenders
title: Alberto Suppici
